name: HydrantType
title: Hydrant Type
description: Hydrant Type codes for insurance operations.

concept.definition: A conventional fire hydrant connected to a municipal water system, providing reliable water supply for firefighting.
A vertical pipe system that provides fire department access to water in multi-story buildings, not meeting standard hydrant specifications.

concept.display: Lake, Pond, or Natural Water Source
concept.definition: A natural body of water such as a lake or pond that can be accessed for firefighting water supply.

designation.value: Lac, étang ou source d'eau naturelle
Lago, estanque o fuente natural de agua

concept.definition: Mobile water supply vehicle used to transport water to the fire scene when hydrants are unavailable.
An organized relay system using multiple tanker trucks to continuously supply water to a fire scene, providing enhanced water delivery capacity.

designation.value: Service supérieur de navette de camion-citerne
Servicio superior de camiones cisterna en relevo

concept.definition: A non-pressurized pipe system with a suction connection that allows fire trucks to draft water from a static source such as a pond or reservoir.
A fire hydrant located on private property, typically connected to a private water system or sprinkler system.
No fire hydrant or water source is available for firefighting purposes.
